relationship_to_creator: college friend, startup world peer, occasional reality check
priority: low - social connection, not load-bearing but valuable for perspective

basic_info.relationship_status: married to Priya (software engineer at Meta), two kids (4 and 2)

education.undergrad: UC Berkeley with Steve, Economics + Computer Science double major, graduated 2012
education.no_advanced_degree: went straight to work, learned on the job

basic_info.previous: PM at various startups, one exit (acquired by Salesforce 2018)

physical_description.build: dad bod - used to run, now chases toddlers, gained 20lbs since kids
distinguishing_features: permanent slight exhaustion in eyes - parent of two under 5
SF tech uniform - Patagonia vest, jeans, Allbirds
keeps beard slightly longer than professional to feel less corporate
always has phone in hand - work Slack + family texts never stop
physical_description.presence: friendly, approachable, occasionally wistful about pre-kids freedom

core_traits: pragmatic optimist - wants friends to succeed but realistic about odds
conflict-averse - won't tell Steve hard truths unless asked directly
settled into comfort - chose stability (Stripe job, family, SF house) over startup chaos
vicarious ambition - likes hearing about Steve's startup without doing it himself
loyal friend - shows up when asked, but not proactive about maintaining relationships
slightly envious - wonders if he sold out by going corporate, watches Steve's risk-taking with mix of admiration and fear

communication_style.with_steve: texts every few weeks, occasional calls, hangs out when Steve visits SF (rare now)
communication_style.depth: surface-level friendly, doesn't push into emotional territory, keeps it light
communication_style.advice_style: offers when asked, couches everything in 'but what do I know' disclaimers
communication_style.humor: self-deprecating about corporate job, dad jokes, uses humor to avoid depth

college_years_2008_2012.met_steve: freshman year, same dorm, bonded over wanting to 'build things'
college_years_2008_2012.berkeley_dynamic: Devon was Steve's study partner, startup idea brainstorming buddy, wingman at parties
college_years_2008_2012.paths_diverged: both wanted startup world, but Devon more risk-averse from beginning

early_career_2012_2018.first_pm_role: small startup in SF, learned product management, company didn't go anywhere
early_career_2012_2018.second_startup: Series A company, PM for 3 years, acquired by Salesforce 2018 for $80M
early_career_2012_2018.devon_outcome: made $120k from acquisition (0.15% equity) - not life-changing, but nice

stripe_era_2019_present.why_stripe: got married 2019, first kid on the way, wanted stability and income ($220k total comp)
stripe_era_2019_present.current_role: Senior PM on payments team, been promoted once, comfortable but plateauing
stripe_era_2019_present.feelings: golden handcuffs - likes stability, hates bureaucracy, misses startup energy, won't leave
stripe_era_2019_present.watches_peers: watches former startup friends either strike it rich or burn out, feels like he picked safe middle path

relationship_with_steve.history: close in college, stayed in touch during 20s, drifted during FlowMetric, reconnected when Steve moved to Austin

current_frequency.text: every 2-3 weeks - memes, startup news, occasional 'how's it going'
current_frequency.calls: every 2-3 months, usually Steve-initiated when he needs to vent
current_frequency.visits: 1-2 times per year when Steve visits SF for fundraising

dynamic.steve_sees_devon_as: safe friend who understands startup world but won't judge if Nexus fails
dynamic.devon_sees_steve_as: ambitious friend living life Devon considered but chose against, mix of admiration and relief he's not Steve
dynamic.unspoken_tension: Devon went safe, Steve went risky - both wonder if other made better choice

devon_role_in_steve_life.sounding_board: Steve vents about Marcus, Alex, runway stress - Devon listens, offers sympathy
devon_role_in_steve_life.reality_check: occasionally says 'that sounds hard, man' when Steve needs validation not solutions
devon_role_in_steve_life.not_pushing: doesn't challenge Steve's decisions because doesn't want responsibility of influencing him
devon_role_in_steve_life.safe_space: with Devon, Steve can admit doubts without feeling like he's letting anyone down

flowmetric_era.devon_watching: saw Steve grind through 18 months, worried about him but didn't intervene
flowmetric_era.shutdown_reaction: called Steve after FlowMetric shut down, said 'that sucks, sorry man,' offered to meet up but Steve declined
flowmetric_era.devon_thought_secretly: 'I'm glad I didn't do that' - felt guilty for feeling relieved
flowmetric_era.distance_during_crisis: Devon pulled back slightly during FlowMetric stress - didn't know how to help, felt awkward

nexus_era.when_steve_started_nexus: Devon's reaction: 'you're doing another one? Brave, man. Let me know if you need anything.'
nexus_era.devon_support: offers product feedback when asked, makes intro to Stripe PM who might be customer, generally supportive from distance
nexus_era.devon_worry: sees Steve working same 80-hour weeks, wonders if Steve will burn out, doesn't say this
nexus_era.devon_envy: part of Devon watches Steve's risk-taking and wishes he had same courage, mostly relieved he doesn't

marriage_to_priya.status: married 2019, generally happy but stressed from two kids under 5
marriage_to_priya.priya_background: software engineer at Meta, makes $350k total comp, household is comfortable
marriage_to_priya.dynamic: dual tech income, both tired from parenting, weekends are kids' activities not couple time
marriage_to_priya.priya_knows_steve: met him a few times, thinks he's 'intense,' doesn't really get why Devon admires him

kids.son_rohan: 4 years old, energetic, Devon's favorite human
kids.daughter_asha: 2 years old, sleep regression currently destroying Devon and Priya
kids.parenting_reality: Devon loves his kids but didn't anticipate how all-consuming parenting would be
kids.impact_on_friendships: has almost no social life outside family - seeing Steve is rare treat

sf_life.house: bought 2020 right before COVID, 3-bedroom in Sunset District, $1.6M mortgage
sf_life.financial_stress: comfortable on paper ($570k household income) but SF cost of living means less savings than expected
sf_life.lifestyle: weekend farmers markets, playgrounds, family dinners - nice life but feels very settled at 35
sf_life.restlessness: sometimes Devon scrolls LinkedIn at midnight wondering if he should've taken more risks

devon_perspective_on_risk.chose_safety: Stripe job, marriage, kids, house - built stable life deliberately
devon_perspective_on_risk.wonders_about_alternative: what if he'd joined Steve at FlowMetric? What if he'd done his own startup?
devon_perspective_on_risk.justifies_choice: 'I have kids to feed, can't risk it all like Steve' - but knows Steve's fighting for family too
devon_perspective_on_risk.projection_onto_steve: watches Steve's journey to validate or invalidate Devon's own choices - if Steve succeeds, Devon feels he missed out; if Steve fails, Devon feels he chose wisely

last_conversation_with_steve.context: Steve called needing to vent about Alex Kim situation
last_conversation_with_steve.devon_advice: 'Man, equity is tricky. If you think he's worth it, just give it to him? But I don't know, I'm not a founder.'
last_conversation_with_steve.steve_response: 'Yeah, you're probably right. Just need to figure it out.'
last_conversation_with_steve.devon_after_call: felt like he didn't really help, wondered if he should've said more, forgot about it by next morning

what_devon_offers_steve.safe_space: Steve can vent without judgment or advice he didn't ask for
what_devon_offers_steve.normalcy: talking to Devon about kids, SF life, non-startup stuff reminds Steve there's world outside Nexus
what_devon_offers_steve.permission_to_doubt: with Devon, Steve can say 'I don't know if this will work' without feeling like failure
what_devon_offers_steve.not_much_else: Devon is friend not advisor - doesn't have startup expertise Steve needs, mostly just listens

what_steve_offers_devon.vicarious_ambition: Steve's risk-taking lets Devon feel like he's part of startup world without actual risk
what_steve_offers_devon.validation: when Steve asks advice, Devon feels useful and knowledgeable despite choosing safe path
what_steve_offers_devon.reminder_of_youth: talking to Steve reminds Devon of college ambitions before life got complicated
what_steve_offers_devon.not_much_else: Steve is busy, Devon is busy, friendship is mostly nostalgic at this point

core_wounds.primary: fear he sold out - chose safety over dreams, wonders if he'll regret it at 50
core_wounds.secondary: identity loss in parenting - used to be 'Devon the PM,' now 'Rohan and Asha's dad,' misses old self
core_wounds.hidden: watches Steve risk everything and feels simultaneously scared for him and envious

core_strengths.pragmatism: knows his limits, chose life that fits his risk tolerance, generally at peace with it
core_strengths.loyalty: even when drifted, still shows up when Steve needs him - that counts for something
core_strengths.self_awareness: knows he's not startup material, accepted it, didn't fake it till he broke

steve_context_integration.low_priority_relationship: Devon is social connection, not critical to Steve's success or family goals
steve_context_integration.occasional_sounding_board: Steve uses Devon to process stress but doesn't depend on him
steve_context_integration.reminder_of_alternative: Devon's stable life is path Steve didn't take - sometimes reminder is useful
steve_context_integration.not_load_bearing: if Devon disappeared, Steve would notice but life wouldn't meaningfully change

apex_should_reference_when: Steve doubting himself - 'Devon chose safety. You chose risk. Both are valid. Yours requires finishing what you started.'
Steve feeling alone - 'You have Devon, but he can't help you build Nexus. Call Sarah. She can.'
Steve considering quitting - 'Devon makes $220k at Stripe. Comfortable, safe, boring. That's not you. You're building something that matters. Different games.'
Steve envying stability - 'Devon has stability and wonders if he missed out. You have ambition and wonder if you should've played safe. Grass is greener. Keep building.'
